acceptContributions.bankAccount.info: Manually sync contributions received on your bank account with your Collective's budget. It's free up to $1000. {hostPlans}.
acceptContributions.definePaymentInstruc: Include any details contributors will need to send you money, such as: account name and number; IBAN, Swift, or routing codes; bank name and address, etc. The amount and order ID will be automatically included.
acceptContributions.FAQ.howDoesItWorkDet: The instructions for the wire transfer are sent to contributors via email with a unique transaction identifier. Once the money has been received in the Host's bank account, the admin of the Host will be able to mark the transaction as received in the Host Dashboard and the funds will be added to the Collective's budget.
acceptContributions.FAQ.idNotIncluded: ¿Qué sucede si el ID no está incluido en la transacción?
acceptContributions.FAQ.idNotIncludedDet: If the ID is not included in the transaction, we can't match it to the donation and it won't show up in the Collective. Please contact {email} if you sent a donation that is not showing up on the Collective so we can trace it.
acceptContributions.FAQ.moneyNotReceived: ¿Qué pasa si el dinero nunca es recibido?
Hosts will only add funds in your Collective when they clear in their bank account. The donation will show as pending until then.
acceptContributions.HowDoesItWork.detail: Financial contributors will be able to choose 'Bank transfer' as a payment method. Instructions to make the transfer, which you define, will be emailed to them, along with a unique order ID. Once you receive the money, you can mark the corresponding pending order as paid and the funds will be credited to the Collective's balance.
acceptContributions.myselfSuccess: You have applied to be hosted by {hostName}.
acceptContributions.notifiedWhen: You will be notified when {hostName} has approved or rejected your application. Contribution tiers will only go live once the Collective is approved by the fiscal host.
acceptContributions.picker.hostInfo: Outsource fundholding to an entity who offers this service ({moreInfo})
acceptContributions.picker.organizationI: Use my company or organization bank account
acceptContributions.picker.subtitle: Who will hold money on behalf of the Collective?
acceptContributions.stripe.info: Automatically accept contributions with credit cards from all over the world. {fees}.
acceptContributions.success.hostSettings: You can manage your Fiscal Host settings — like adding more payment methods — from your Fiscal Host Organization's profile. {takeMeThere}.
acceptContributions.success.nowAccepting: Congratulations! {collective} is now accepting financial contributions.
acceptContributions.success.toConsider: Algunas cosas más que deberías considerar:
acceptContributions.tiers.paragraphOne: We created a one-time donation tier for you to begin with. Go ahead and create different one-time and subscription tiers to define the levels or types of financial contributions your collective accepts. {knowMore}.
acceptContributions.tos.label: I agree with the {hostTosLink} of {hostName}.
acceptContributions.tosError: Por favor, acepte los términos de servicio del patrocinador.

collective.created: Tu colecta ha sido registrada con éxito.
collective.created.description: Mientras esperas la aprobación de tu anfitrión ({host}), puedes comenzar a personalizar tu colecta, la hoja de gastos e incluso registrar eventos.

collective.delete.description: Este {type} será borrado, junto con todos los datos relacionados como los roles de los Contribuyentes principales y métodos de pago.
collective.delete.isHost: No puede borrar su colectivo mientras siga siendo un Anfitrión, por favor, desactive primero su rol como Anfitrión.

collective.edit.host.findHost.descriptio: Con esta opción, no necesita guardar los fondos usted mismo, o crear una entidad legal y una cuenta bancaria para su proyecto. El patrocinador fiscal se encargará de la contabilidad, las facturas, los impuestos, los administradores, los pagos y la responsabilidad. La mayoría de los patrocinadores cobran una cuota por este servicio (puede revisar estos detalles en la página del patrocinadores antes de confirmar).
collective.edit.host.findHost.title: Aplicar para un patrocinador fiscal existente
collective.edit.host.noHost.description: Sin un patrocinador fiscal, no puede recibir dinero. Aún puedes usar otras herramientas, como editar su página del Colectivo, enviar gastos y publicar actualizaciones.
collective.edit.host.noHost.title: No hay patrocinador fiscal
collective.edit.host.suggestedHosts.desc: Basado en las etiquetas de su Colectivo ({tags})
collective.edit.host.suggestedHosts.empt: No hay sugerencias. Por favor revise todos los patrocinadores disponibles o considere crear un nuevo patrocinador.
collective.edit.host.useOwn.description: Reciba los fondos de uno o más Colectivos en su cuenta bancaria. Usted será responsable de pagar los gastos aprobados por el Colectivo y manejar la contabilidad e impuestos.
collective.edit.host.useOwn.title: Usar mi propio anfitrión fiscal
collective.editHost.withdrawApp: ¿Está seguro que desea retirar la solicitud de {name}?
collective.event.delete.isNotDeletable-m: Eventos con transacciones, ordenes o gastos pagados no pueden ser borrados. Por favor archívalos.
collective.expensePolicy.description: Puede ser abrumador presentar un gasto si no está seguro de lo que está permitido. Proporcione una política clara para guiar a los remitentes de gastos.
collective.expensePolicy.label: Política de gastos del Colectivo
collective.expensePolicy.placeholder: Por ejemplo: qué tipo de gastos se aprobarán, cualquier limitaciones en el monto, qué documentación se necesita, y quién contactar con preguntas.
collective.githubflow.created.descriptio: Ya está aprobado por el patrocinador ({host}), ya puede recibir donaciones. Siéntase libre de personalizar su colectivo, archivar gastos e incluso crear eventos.
collective.hostAccount.activate.descript: Un anfitrión fiscal es una entidad legal que mantiene los fondos del Colectivo en su cuenta bancaria y que puede generar facturas y recibos para los contribuyentes y patrocinadores.
collective.hostAccount.deactivate.descri: Después de desactivar su organización como anfitrión, usted no será capaz de alojar colectivos. El perfil permanecerá activo como un perfil de tipo {type}.
collective.hostAccount.deactivate.isHost: No puede desactivar el alojamiento mientras siga alojando {hostedCollectives} colectivos.
collective.hostAccount.modal.activate.bo: ¿Está seguro de que desea activar esta cuenta como un Anfitrión Fiscal?
¿Está seguro de que desea desactivar esta cuenta de Anfitrión Fiscal?
collective.hostAccount.modal.description: Un anfitrión fiscal es una compañía legal o un individuo que mantiene los fondos del Colectivo en su cuenta bancaria y que puede generar facturas y recibos para los Contribuyentes Financieros.{br}Un anfitrión fiscal puede ser visto como una organización que cubre a los Colectivos que aloja.
collective.hostFeePercent.description: La comisión de las contribuciones financieras a los colectivos que usted patrocina fiscalmente.
Puedes pagar gastos con un solo clic usando TransferWise.
collective.hostSettings.help.fundsLimit: La cantidad máxima de fondo añadida, durante cualquier periodo de tiempo, a través de todos los colectivos.
collective.hostSettings.help.manualPayme: Tus colaboradores crean una donación pendiente y reciben instrucciones de correo electrónico con tus datos bancarios. Puedes conciliar la donación cuando la recibas.
collective.image.label: Avatar
collective.isArchived.description: Este colectivo ha sido archivado y no podrá seguir siendo usado para ninguna actividad.

CollectivePage.Contribute.Custom.Descrip: Contribuye de manera única o recurrente para ayudar a este colectivo.
CollectivePage.ContributorsDescription: Quienes que han apoyado {collectiveName}. Personas y organizaciones que confían en –y se hacen co-propietarios de– nuestro propósito.
CollectivePage.SectionBudget.Annual.Defi: Presupuesto anual proyectado basado en el total de contribuciones financieras de los últimos 12 meses.
CollectivePage.SectionBudget.Description: Vea cómo el dinero circula abiertamente a través de {collectiveName}. Todas las contribuciones y todos los gastos se publican en nuestro libro de contabilidad público transparente. ¡Aprenda quién está donando, cuánto dinero va a llegar, presentar gastos, reembolsar y mucho más!

collectives.create.description: Una Organización permite realizar donaciones como una compañía o un equipo. Es posible agregar una tarjeta de crédito con un límite mensual para que los miembros del equipo puedan hacer donaciones.

contribute.noPaymentMethod: The balance of this collective is too low to make orders from it. Add funds to {collectiveName} by making a donation to it first.

contribute.vatBadCountry: The VAT number doesn't match the country
contributeAs.org.name: Nombre de la organización
ContributeDetails.faq.frequency.content: Se le cobrará hoy, y luego el día 1 de cada mes (para contribuciones mensuales) o el día 1 del mismo mes del próximo año (para contribuciones anuales). Nota: Para evitar que se le cobra dos veces en un periodo corto de tiempo, si contribuye después del día 15 de un mes dado, el siguiente cargo no será el 1 del próximo mes, sino el mes siguiente.
ContributeDetails.faq.frequency.title: ¿Cuándo se me cobrará la próxima vez?
ContributeDetails.faq.isIncognito.conten: Si eligió contribuir como "anónimo", su donación se mostrará públicamente como una donación anónima y no será vinculada a su perfil público. Sin embargo, en nuestro esfuerzo por ser transparentes y cumplir con las regulaciones KYC (Conozca a su Cliente, KYC por sus siglas en inglés), el anfitrión fiscal y los administradores del colectivo pueden exportar una lista de todos los contribuyentes financieros junto con su información personal.
ContributeDetails.faq.isIncognito.title: ¿Qué es una donación anónima?

createAccount.alreadyLoggedIn: Parece que ya ha iniciado sesión como "{email}". Si desea crear una nueva cuenta, cierre la sesión primero.
createCollective.acceptTermsOfFiscalSpon: Please accept the terms of fiscal sponsorship
createCollective.form.descriptionHint: Write a short description of your Collective (150 characters max)
createCollective.form.error.description: Por favor, utiliza menos de 160 caracteres
createCollective.form.error.name: Por favor, usa menos de 50 caracteres
createCollective.form.error.slug: Por favor, utiliza menos de 30 caracteres
createCollective.form.nameLabel: ¿Cuál es el nombre de tu colectivo?
createcollective.hosttos.label: I agree with the the {hosttoslink} of the host that will collect money on behalf of our collective.
createcollective.opensource.p1: You're creating software. You don't want to worry about creating a legal entity or separate bank account, paying taxes, or providing invoices to sponsors. Let us take care of all that, so you can stay focused on your project.
createcollective.opensource.p2: We have created the {osclink}, a non-profit umbrella organization, to serve the open source community. To join, you need at least 100 stars on GitHub or meet our {criterialink}.
createcollective.opensource.p4: Our fees cover operating costs like accounting, payments, tax reporting, invoices, legal liability, use of the Open Collective Platform, and providing support. We also run a range of initiatives for our mission of supporting a sustainable and healthy open source ecosystem. Learn more on our website. Join us!
createcollective.opensourcetos.label: I agree with the {toslink}.
createCollective.subtitle.introduce: Introduce your Collective to the community.
createcollective.tos.label: I agree with the {toslink} of Open Collective.
CreateConversation.Body.Placeholder: Puedes añadir enlaces, listas, fragmentos de código y más usando este editor de texto. Escribe y empieza a añadir contenido a tu conversación aquí.
CreateConversation.Title.Placeholder: Empieza con un título para tu conversación aquí
CreateConversationFAQ.moderation.content: Los administradores de este colectivo pueden eliminar conversaciones que no son apropiadas para la comunidad. Por favor, sea un buen ciudadano de la comunidad.
CreateConversationFAQ.replies.content: Recibirás una notificación por correo electrónico cuando alguien responda. Puedes darte de baja de esas notificaciones en cualquier momento.
CreateConversationFAQ.target.content: Todas las conversaciones son públicas. Cualquiera puede verlas y responder a ellas.
CreateExpense.HelpCreateInfo: Request payment from {collective} for work you’ve done or to be reimbursed for purchases. Expenses will be processed for payment once approved by a Collective admin. Only the amount and description are public in the Collective’s transparent budget—attachments, payment details, and other personal info is kept private.
CreateExpenseFAQ.getPaid: How do I get paid from a Collective?
CreateExpenseFAQ.getPaidDetails: Submit an expense and provide your payment information.
CreateExpenseFAQ.howAreApprovedDetails: Collective admins are notified when an expense is submitted and they can approve or reject it.
CreateExpenseFAQ.isItPublic: Is my private data made public?
CreateExpenseFAQ.isItPublicDetails: No. Only the expense amount and description are public. Attachments, payment info, emails and addresses are only visible to you and the admins.
CreateExpenseFAQ.whenPaidDetails: Los pagos son procesados por el anfitrión fiscal del Collective, la organización que tiene los fondos en tu nombre. Muchos anfitriones fiscales pagan gastos semanalmente, pero cada uno es diferente.
createOrder.backToTier: Ver todas las demás formas de contribuir
createOrder.inactiveCollective: Este colectivo no está activo y no puede aceptar contribuciones financieras
createOrder.missingHost: Este colectivo no tiene un anfitrión y no puede aceptar contribuciones financieras
createOrder.missingTier: ¡Oops! Este nivel no existe o ha sido eliminado por los administradores del colectivo.
CreateOrder.Title: Contribuir a {collective}
createPledge.conditions:
Por el momento, solo puedes prometer proyectos de Código Abierto con un repositorio u organización de GitHub. ¡Nosotros
                pedimos al proyecto que tenga al menos 100 estrellas en GitHub!
createPledge.faq.howToClaim:
Necesitarás autenticarte con el perfil de Github que posees / administradores de ese proyecto. Haga clic en botón
                Reclamar Collective en el colectivo prometido. Lanzaremos otras formas de autenticación
                en el futuro.
createPledge.faq.howToClaimSummary: How do I claim a pledged collective?
createPledge.faq.pay: Once that pledged collective is claimed, we will email you to fulfill your pledge.
createPledge.faq.what:
A pledge allows supporters (companies and individuals) to pledge
                funds towards a collective that hasn’t been created yet. If you can’t find a collective you want to
                support, pledge to it!
createPledge.faq.whatHappens:
Una vez que alguien hace una promesa a un colectivo, automáticamente creamos un colectivo. No enviamos spam a
                personas, así que por favor ayúdanos a llegar a la comunidad a través de twitter / github o, si puedes, por correo electrónico.
createPledge.faq.whatHappensSummary: ¿Qué pasa después de que me comprometo?
createPledge.githubURL: URL de GitHub: ¡repositorio u organización con al menos 100 estrellas!
createPledge.onceTheyCreateIt:
Una vez que lo crean (y verifiquen que poseen la URL tú introducirás este formulario), recibirás un
                correo electrónico para pedirte que cumplas con tu compromiso.
createPledge.priviledge:
Te has ganado el privilegio de nombrar y describir esta increíble causa. Crearemos una página colectiva
                        para que otras personas puedan encontrarla y comprometerse a ella también.
createPledge.signinToCreate: <signin-link>Inicia sesión o únete gratis</signin-link> para crear un causa.
createPledge.why:
If the cause or collective that you want to support is not yet on Open Collective, you can make a
                pledge. This will incentivize them to create an open collective for their activities and offer you much
                more visibility on how your money is spent to advance their cause.
createProfile.faq.anonymous.content: Yes you can! However, in the effort of being transparent and compliant with KYC regulations (Know Your Customer), anonymous contributions still require you to create an Open Collective account with a valid email address. You will have the opportunity to make a donation anonymously after being logged in to make sure that your identity won't be shown publicly on the page of the collective.
createProfile.faq.anonymous.title: ¿Puedo hacer una aportación anónima?
createProfile.faq.email.content: For legal reasons, your email is shared with the administrators of the collective and of its fiscal host. We don't share it with any other partner. We don't use it for any type of marketing. We hate spam as much as you do.
createProfile.faq.email.title: ¿Con quién será compartido mi correo electrónico?
createProfile.faq.giftsCardsWithIncognit: Unfortunately, gifts cards cannot be used with incognito profiles. Allowing this could allow malicious users to find out what your main profile is. The protection of your personal information is too important for us to take this risk!
¿Por qué no puedo ver mi tarjeta de regalo?
createProfile.faq.persoVsOrg.content: Create an organization profile if you want to make a financial contribution in the name of your company or organization. An organization profile allows you to enable other members of your organization to make financial contributions within certain limits that you can define. Organizations can also issue gift cards.
createProfile.faq.persoVSOrg.title: What's the difference between a personal and an organization profile?
createProfile.faq.privacy.content: We care about privacy. We don't use cookies. No Google Analytics. No tracking. Then why are we asking you for your personal information? Because for legal reasons the host of the collective needs to know who is giving them money (KYC as in Know Your Customer). However, we give you full control on how your information is being shown publicly (yes you can make incognito contributions, see below).
createProfile.faq.privacy.title: ¿Qué hay de la privacidad?
CreateUpdateFAQ.moderation.content: Only the administrators of this collective can post updates.
CreateUpdateFAQ.notification: Who gets a notification whenever there is a new update?
CreateUpdateFAQ.notification.content: All contributors of the collective will receive a notification by default. They can easily unsubscribe with one click.
CreateUpdateFAQ.replies: What should we use updates for?
CreateUpdateFAQ.target.content: Updates can be public or private in which case only the contributors of the collective can see them. Whenever you post a new update, you can define whether it should be public or private.
CreateUpdateFAQ.whatfor.content: Updates are great to keep your community of contributors up to date with what you do. They should preferably be low volume (at least once a month, ideally no more than once a week). If your contributors hear regularly from you, they will more likely engage, help you and continue to support you. Updates are also great for your fiscal sponsor and for writing reports for grants that you may have.

creditcard.save: Guardar esta tarjeta de crédito en {type, select, user {mi cuenta} other {{type} cuenta}}

EditCollective.Conversations.description: Las conversaciones son una manera de que la gente publique mensajes a los que cualquiera puede responder. Una vez activado, se añadirá una nueva sección "Conversaciones" a tu página de Colectivo y se creará una página dedicada en {conversationsLink}.
editCollective.host.balance: Tu anfitrión actualmente tiene asegurado {balance} en nombre de tu Colectivo.
editCollective.host.change.balanceNotEmp: If you would like to change fiscal host, you first need to empty your Collective balance. You can do this by submitting expenses, or by transferring funds to another Collective (select your Collective balance as the payment method when making a financial contribution) or to your host (via Advanced).
editCollective.host.change.removeFirst: Una vez eliminado, tu Colectivo ya no podrá aceptar contribuciones financieras. Podrás solicitar a otro anfitrión.

editCollective.notFound: No hay datos del colectivo para editar
EditCollective.Updates.description: Updates is a way to keep your community posted on your progress. They are sent by email to all you contributors and followers. Once enabled, a new "Updates" section will be added to your profile page and a dedicated page will be created on {updatesLink}.

EditGoals.Instructions: Puedes definir metas personalizadas para compartir una visión general de tu plan financiero con tu comunidad y para seguir la pista de tu progreso. Serán enviados en los correos electrónicos enviados a tus contribuyentes. Puedes elegir mostrarlos en tu página colectiva marcando la casilla de abajo.

expense.created: Su gasto ha sido enviado con éxito. Ahora está pendiente la aprobación de uno de los colaboradores principales del colectivo. Se le notificará por correo electrónico una vez que haya sido aprobado. Una vez aprobado, {host} procederá a reembolsar su gasto.

expenseNeedsTaxForm.hover: We can't pay until we receive your tax info. Check your inbox for an email from HelloWorks. Need help? Contact support@opencollective.com
expenseNeedsTaxFormMessage.msg: We need your tax information before we can pay you. You will receive an email from HelloWorks saying Open Collective is requesting you fill out a form. This is required by the IRS (US tax agency) for everyone who invoices $600 or more per year. If you have not received the email within 24 hours, or you have any questions, please contact <I18nSupportLink></I18nSupportLink>. For more info, see our <Link>help docs about taxes</Link>.

Fields.name: Name
fiscalHost.apply.info: With this option, you don't need to set up a legal entity and bank account for your project. The fiscal host will hold funds on your behalf, and take care of accounting, invoices, tax, admin, payments, and liability. Most hosts charge a fee for this service (you can review these details on the host's page before confirming).
Fiscalhost.definition: A fiscal host is a legal entity holding the money and responsible for the admin/taxes forms for the collective.
fiscalHost.interestedInHosting: Are you interested in fiscally hosting Collectives?
Footer.Languages.JoinEffort: No se requiere ninguna habilidad técnica para contribuir con las traducciones. Puedes unirte al esfuerzo en {crowdinLink}🌐
FormError.pattern: This value is not formatted properly
GiftCard.definition: Gift cards empower your employees or community members to support the projects they love. Learn more about them <learn-more-link>here</learn-more-link>.
Giftcard.learnMore: Más información sobre Tarjetas de Regalo
giftcard.user.name: Hola de nuevo, {name}!
giftcard.user.text: You can now support open collectives with this amount, courtesy of {emitter}.
GithubRepositories.faq.cost.content: The Open Source Collective 501c6 is taking 5% of all donation received (on top of the 5% for the Open Collective platform). This is to cover the administrative overhead, accounting, legal. That way you never have to worry about all that boring stuff and you can focus on your project.
GithubRepositories.faq.cost.title: What is the cost?
GithubRepositories.faq.host.content: We have created a non profit, the Open Source Collective 501c6 in the United States to act as a fiscal sponsor to host all open source projects. This makes it easy for companies to donate to your project since they can receive one consolidated invoice.
GithubRepositories.faq.host.title: Where is my collective going to be hosted (fiscal sponsored)?
GithubRepositories.faq.repoStar.content: In order to provide fiscal sponsorship to a project, we need to ensure that there is a community around it. If you don’t fit 100 GitHub stars requirement, we will consider your application on a case by case basis, <criteria-link>using this criteria.</criteria-link> If you already have a legal entity (or know a legal entity that could host your collective), then you could directly host your collective independently. Please use the <for-any-community>For any Community</for-any-community> option when creating a collective. Note that in that case you will be responsible for doing the accounting as well as facilitating payments from sponsors. If you have a project with an existing community but don't use GitHub, apply via the <open-source>Open Source</open-source> option and select 'Request manual verification'.
GithubRepositories.faq.repoStar.title: Why only repos with at least 100 stars?
goal.balance.label: Balance
goal.show: Show the goals on my collective page
goal.title.label: Título
goal.type.label: Type
HeroBackground.Instructions: Use your mouse wheel or pinch to change the zoom, drag and drop to adjust position.
home.feature.celebrateSupporters.descrip: Leaderboard of your top funders, plus highlight how your whole community contributes in different ways.
home.feature.engageCommunity.description: Publica actualizaciones para involucrar a los colaboradores, mostrar el progreso del proyecto y el impacto del financiamiento recibido. Usa las Conversaciones como un foro de discusión comunitaria.
home.feature.getMonthlyReports.descripti: Un resumen de las actividades de su colectivo, el progreso en sus objetivos de presupuesto, nuevos colaboradores y detalles de gastos, con el detalle de las transacciones y recibos adjuntos.
home.feature.manageExpenses.description: Contributors and vendors can easily submit receipts and invoices. You approve or reject them, and once paid your balance updates automatically.
home.feature.receiveContributions.descri: Acepte pagos con tarjeta de crédito, transferencia bancaria y Paypal. Defina niveles personalizados y establezca metas financieras para motivar a sus colaboradores.
home.feature.shareBudget.description: Todo el mundo puede ver de dónde procede y a dónde va el dinero. ¡Claridad y responsabilidad sin hojas de cálculo ni trabajo extra!
home.featureSection.subTitle: Discover the possibilities of our features.
home.featureSection.title: Cómo usar Open Collective
home.fiscalHostSection.explanation1: Some Collectives don’t have a bank account or legal entity set up to receive funds, and want help taking care of things like tax reporting and financial admin. We call organizations who provide this service (sometimes called fiscal sponsorship) Fiscal Hosts.
home.fiscalHostSection.explanation2: Open Collective allows fiscal hosts to reduce overhead and easily manage budgets and expenses for multiple projects. Our automated reporting makes accounting a breeze. No more messy spreadsheets!
home.fiscalHostSection.title: Open Collective for Fiscal Hosts
home.joinUsSection.joinTeam: We are citizens from around the world. We don’t have an office. We are all remote. We don’t bite.
home.joinUsSection.newsletter: Suscríbete a nuestro boletín de noticias
home.joinUsSection.subtitle: ¡Sé parte de la comunidad y difunde la palabra!
home.joinUsSection.title: ¡Únete a nosotros!
home.joinUsSection.weNeedUpdate: Enviamos actualizaciones una vez al mes.
home.learMoreSection.subtitle: Our mission is to help organize the world in open circles, where everyone can contribute. We are starting with financial contributions, enabling communities to raise money while staying true to who they are.
home.learnMore.blog: Stay up to date with the latest news, collectives and sponsors’ stories. Our newsletter and updates are regularly published as well.
home.learnMore.documentation: Discover how to create an open collective, how to become a Fiscal Host, how to use our software, our API and much more.
home.learnMore.slack: Come meet us, chat with us and share your stories.
home.learnMore.slack.buttonText: Únete a nuestro espacio de trabajo en Slack
home.makeCommunitySection.description: La comunidad se trata de confianza y de compartir. Open Collective le permite gestionar sus finanzas de forma que todos puedan ver de dónde proviene el dinero y hacia dónde va el mismo.
home.makeCommunitySection.subTitle: Recolecte dinero y utilícelo de forma transparente.
home.OCusers.meetups: Nearly 100 chapters of Women Who Code use Open Collective to raise money locally and allocate donations throughout their network.
home.OCusers.movements: Many local XR groups are using Open Collective to be transparent, engage their communities, and cover their expenses.
home.OCusers.opensource: More than 1,700 open source communities use Open Collective to receive money from companies and individuals.
home.OCUsersSection.subtitle: Communities around the world are using Open Collective. Find out more about them!
home.OCUsersSection.title: ¿Quién está usando Open Collective?
home.weAreOpenSection.openCompany.descri: Nuestras métricas, finanzas y otros documentos son públicos.
home.weAreOpenSection.openCompany.linkTe: Enlace público a nuestro Google Drive
home.weAreOpenSection.openData.descripti: We will never lock you in. Your data is yours and can be exported anytime.
home.weAreOpenSection.openFinances.descr: We operate as an Open Collective ourselves, with transparent budgets.
home.weAreOpenSection.openSource.descrip: Todo lo que hacemos es de código abierto.
home.weAreOpenSection.subtitle: No sólo le ayudamos a ser transparente, ¡nosotros también lo somos!
home.weAreOpenSection.title: We are open in every way
home.whatCanYouDoSection.areYouReady: ¿Está listo para hacer que su comunidad sea sostenible?
home.whatCanYouDoSection.collectMoney.lo: Receive funds by credit card, Paypal, or bank transfer, and record everything in your transparent budget. Define different ways people can contribute with customizable tiers and rewards.
home.whatCanYouDoSection.manageMoney.lon: Create Collectives for different projects for easy budget tracking. No need for messy spreadsheets! Automatic monthly reports make accounting a breeze.
home.whatCanYouDoSection.spendMoney.long: Anyone in your community can submit expenses. Once approved, pay in one click with Paypal or manually. All transactions are public in your transparent budget (with personal information kept private).
home.whatCanYouDoSection.subTitle: Accept donations and sponsorships, celebrate your supporters, pay expenses, and keep everyone up to date — all in one place.
home.whatCanYouDoSection.title: ¿Qué puede hacer en Open Collective?
host.hostFee.help: The host fee is the fee that the host charges your collective to take care of paying out the expenses that have been approved and to take care of recording all transactions in their books to comply with local fiscal authorities.

paymentMethod.activeSubscriptions: {n} active {n, plural, one {recurring financial contribution} other {recurring financial contributions}}
paymentmethod.label: Método de Pago
paymentMethod.manual.edit.description: Contributors will be able to choose "Bank Transfer" as a payment method when they check out. The instructions to make the wire transfer will be emailed to them along with a unique order id. Once you received the money, you will be able to mark the corresponding pending order as paid in your host dashboard.
paymentMethod.manual.edit.description.pr: There is no platform fee for donations made this way. However, we ask you to kindly subscribe to our special plans for fiscal hosts to be able to maintain and improve this feature over time (the first $1,000 of yearly budget are included in the free plan)
paymentMethod.monthlyLimitPerMember.desc: Set a monthly limit to allow other team members of your Organization to use this credit card within that limit. If set to zero, only Organization admins will be able to use this card.
paymentMethod.typeSelect: {type, select, virtualcard {Gift card} creditcard {Credit card} prepaid {Prepaid}}
paymentMethod.whyUnknown: This recurring contribution was created using an earlier version of our site which didn't store credit card numbers. We suggest that you update it.
paymentMethod.whyUnknownTitle: Why is my credit card not showing up?
paymentMethods.manual.add: Añade los datos de tu cuenta bancaria
paymentMethods.manual.add.info: To receive donations  directly on your bank account on behalf of the collectives that you are hosting
paymentMethods.manual.bankInfo.title: Add your bank account information
paymentMethods.manual.edit: Editar los datos de tu cuenta bancaria
paymentMethods.manual.instructions.title: Define las instrucciones para realizar una transferencia bancaria a tu cuenta
paymentMethods.manual.upgradePlan: Subscribe to our special plans for hosts
paymentMethods.removeConfirm: ¿Realmente desea eliminar este método de pago de su cuenta?
paymentMethods.send.title: Enviando dinero
platformFee.info:
Open Collective has waived 100% of our fees for COVID-19 Relief Collectives. We rely on the generosity
                of contributors like you to keep offering this to Collectives.
platformFee.support: Thank you for supporting us with a contribution:
platformFee.taxDeductible: This Collective's Fiscal Host is a registered 501 c(3) non-profit organization. Your contributione will be tax-deductible to the extent allowed by the law.
pledge.definition:
A pledge is a way for the community to show interest in supporting a cause or project that is not yet on
              Open Collective, just like {collective}. This will incentivize them to create a
              collective for their activities and offer you much more visibility on how your money is spent to advance
              their cause. Once they create it, you will receive an email to ask you to fulfill your pledge.
pledge.ownerDetails:
You can claim this collective! You will be able to start raising funds and manage your expenses
                  transparently. We will contact the organizations and individuals who made commitment for them to
                  fulfill their pledge.
pledge.stats: {orgCount, plural, =0 {} one {# organization} other {# organizations}} {both, plural, =0 {} one { and }} {userCount, plural, =0 {} one {# individual } other {# individuals }} {totalCount, plural, one {has } other {have }} already pledged a total of {amount} {currency}
pricing.accessTo.bankTransfer: Enable bank transfer payments to automatically provide financial contributors with wire instructions and a reference number for tracking.
pricing.accessTo.financialContributions: Receive financial contributions to Collectives via credit card, automatically updating their budgets for easy tracking (cost: 5% plus Stripe fees).
pricing.accessTo.hostDashboard: A host dashboard to easily manage budgets and expenses across all your Collectives, including one-click payouts via Paypal.
pricing.accessTo.manuallyCredit: Manually credit Collective budgets with funds received outside the platform (e.g. payments you've invoiced, cash, or third party channels like a shop).
pricing.fiscalHost.applyOpenSource: If you are an open source project, you can apply to join  the Open Source Collective.
pricing.fiscalHost.description: A Fiscal Host is an organization who offers fund-holding as a service. They keep your money in their bank account and handle things like accounting, taxes, admin, payments, and liability-so you don’t have to!
pricing.fiscalHost.featured: Below are some of our most popular hosts or <hosts-link>browse all of them</hosts-link>.
pricing.fiscalHost.learnMore: Learn more about becoming a Fiscal Host.
pricing.fiscalHost.reasonToJoin: If you join a Fiscal Host, you don’t need to go on an Open Collective paid plan, as your Collective is already included. Each Fiscal Host sets their own fees and acceptance criteria for Collectives. Open Collective keeps a 5% of the donations you raise via credit card payments (Stripe). All other payment methods such as PayPal and Bank transfers are included in your Host's plan.
pricing.hostCollective.count: {count, plural, =0 {No collective} one {{prettyCount} collective} other {{prettyCount} collectives} }
pricing.hostOrganization.note1: Your choice of plan will depend on the number of Collectives you host.
pricing.hostOrganization.note2: You pay Open Collective for use of our platform on behalf of your Collectives, and can charge them a fee if you wish.
pricing.starterPlans.addFunds: Manually add funds raised through other channels (e.g. bank transfers) to your transparent budget (free up to $1,000, then you’ll need to upgrade to a paid plan).
pricing.starterPlans.collective: Collective - a page to coordinate your community and budget.
pricing.starterPlans.communication: Communication tools: post updates, start conversations, and a contact form for your group.
pricing.starterPlans.fundraise: Fundraise through credit card payments (cost: 5% plus Stripe payment processor fees).
pricing.starterPlans.transferwisePayouts: Pay expenses in local currency with one-click using the TransferWise integration.
pricing.tab.description: You will begin with the STARTER PLAN. This plan is FREE to set up!
pricing.tab.hostOrganization.description: You will be a Fiscal Host on our platform. That means you hold funds on behalf of Collectives. You decide which Collectives to accept and what if any fees to charge them.
pricing.tab.joinHost: If you don't have access to a bank account you can use, please join a Fiscal Host!
pricing.title: Our pricing
pricingTable.row.addFunds: Add funds received through other channels
pricingTable.row.directPayment: Credit card payments direct to Collectives
pricingTable.row.hostFeature: Link for Collectives to discover and apply to your host
processorFeeRefunded.checkbox.label: Also refund payment processor fees
profile.incognito.description: Keep my contribution private (see FAQ for more info)
redeem.card.authenticated: You are currently authenticated. Sign Out first if you want to redeem with another account.
redeem.card.info: It's easy! Just enter your name, email address and gift code. We will create an account for you if you don't already have one. You'll be able to select the gift card as the payment method when making a contribution.
redeem.card.success.instructions: We’ve sent an email to {email} with instructions to verify your new Open Collective account and credit it with the amount of your gift card.
redeem.card.success.title: You are one step away from supporting open collectives.
redeem.form.code.label: Gift card code
redeem.fromCollective: You're about to redeem a gift card, courtesy of {collective}
redeem.subtitle.line1: Open Collective helps communities - like open source projects, meetups and social movements - raise funds spend them transparently.
redeem.title: Redeem Gift Card
redeemed.backyourstack: or discover the open source projects that your organization is depending on and that need funding on {link}
redeemed.subtitle.line1: The card has been added to your account.
redeemed.subtitle.line2: Ahora puedes donar a cualquier colectivo que elijas.
redeemed.suggestions: o puedes elegir de estos increíbles colectivos que están haciendo un genial trabajo:
RoleDetails.ADMIN: Admins can edit the Collective, change settings, approve expenses, make financial contributions to other Collectives and receive messages from people trying to contact the Collective.
RoleDetails.MEMBER: Core contributors are major contributors and represent the Collective with their face on the Collective page as part of the team.
